verses.text: Praise the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.
I will praise the LORD all my life; I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 146
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 146 The last five psalms are hymns marked by opening and closing cries of “Praise the Lord,” characterizing their pervasive mood.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 146:1
rsbNotes.text: 146:1 O my soul. See note Ps. 103:1.

verses.text: Do not put your trust in princes, in mortal men, who cannot save.
When their spirit departs, they return to the ground; on that very day their plans come to nothing.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 146:3
rsbNotes.text: 146:3 in princes. Some believe that this reference is to foreign kings who rule over Judah after the nation’s Babylonian exile of the sixth century b.c. However, there were earlier times when the children of Israel misplaced their trust in native rulers (1 Sam. 8).

verses.text: Blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in the LORD his God,

rsbNotes.title: Ps 146:5
rsbNotes.text:
146:5 Blessed. See Ps. 1:1.

whose help. God is the only One capable of helping those in distress. This verse provides the theme of the psalm, and the following verses describe His power and compassion.

verses.text: the Maker of heaven and earth, the sea, and everything in them- the LORD, who remains faithful forever.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 146:6
rsbNotes.text:
146:6 who made. God’s role as Creator is highlighted to emphasize His power.

the sea. See Ps. 24:2.

verses.text: He upholds the cause of the oppressed and gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets prisoners free,
the LORD gives sight to the blind, the LORD lifts up those who are bowed down, the LORD loves the righteous.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 146:7
rsbNotes.text: 146:7 the oppressed . . . the hungry. See 9:18 note; 72:4.

verses.text: The LORD watches over the alien and sustains the fatherless and the widow, but he frustrates the ways of the wicked.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 146:9
rsbNotes.text: 146:9 the wicked he brings to ruin. While God promotes the cause of the weak, He resists the proud and abusive.

verses.text: The LORD reigns forever, your God, O Zion, for all generations. Praise the LORD.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 146:10
rsbNotes.text:
146:10 reign forever. See Ps. 93:1.

O Zion. See 2:6 note; 50:2; 74:2; 84:7; 128:5; 129:5; 137:6.

Praise the Lord. See v. 1.
